At INTENDED Post OR ACTUAL DHAMDOD-LUMBHA PERMANENT ADDRESS ABROAD BARDOLi 6(a) I voluntarily, willingly and affirmatively am abandoning have abandoned my status as lawful permanent resident of the United States, because: due to my health I moved back to India 6(b) Documents Surrendered: I - 151 A 21-534-625 6(c) Date of Abandonment of Status as Lawrul Permanent Resident of the United States: 7-19-1977 6(d) REMARKS OF IMMIGRATION/CONSULAR OFFICER: If you waive your right to a hearing now, you can have a hearing at any time hereafter before an immi- gration judge to determine your admissibility by presenting yourself at a port of entry to the United States and seeking entry. If you do seek a later hearing the immigration judge can and will take into account all statements you have made concerning your abandonment of residence in the United States. APPI for admission on TW - 801 presented Indian PPH 562092 which contains B-1/D-2visa issued in Bombay 11-5-86 and T - 151 Appl was visit whisstated was willing that to give up was her organized for a accompanied by lle. his son Nathubhai Patel A37-068-105 Mother SIGNATURE 112Cappula OFFICE JFK-NYC 6(e) I have read and understand the above statements or it has been read to me and is true and correct. I also understand (If I am at this time an applicant for admission into the United States) that [ have the right to appear before an immigration judge for a hearing to determine my admissibility into the United States as a returning lawful permanent resident. I freely waive my right to a hearing before an immigration judge.
